title: Report specific insertion codons
body: Currently, hivmmer reports the frequency of an insertion of any codon. Instead, report the frequency of each specific codon that was inserted.

title: Validate hxb2 coordinates
body:
In some edges cases, the output will no longer be in hxb2 coordinates. This can happen if:

1. The sample has zero coverage at a site.
2. The sample has 100% deletions at a site.

In both cases, the site will be dropped in the hmmsearch1 pHMM, and the resulting hmmsearch2 alignment is no longer in hxb2 coordinates. As a workaround, the hmmsearch1 results can be used, as these are in hxb2 coordinates based on the way the reference pHMM is constructed by `hivmmer-trim-reference`.

For a longer-term solution, the final results should be aligned back against hxb2 to validate the coordinates.

title: Subtype C
body:
Hey everyone,

How hard would it be to implement support for subtype C? I'm happy to do this if you could all point me at what would have to happen to add support. I looked through the code and it looks like it would be pretty straightforward, but was wondering what you think.

title: What should I be using as a reference?
body:
I'm having trouble getting the reference to work--can you help me figure out how to specify one of the pre-built alignments? 

Thank you!

title: support for Gag?
body:
I noticed that there is no option to specify "gag" as the region. I made my own reference (thanks for the help with that) for gag but seems a region must be specified from pol, int, or env. It looks like maybe this is only used for noting what gene a codon is in--if that is the case, can I just use int as the region, or is there more going on here? Or can I change the code to add "gag" as an option for the reference?

Thank you!
Sara

title: Add QC stage for filtering on quality score and read length
body:
Default settings per the Winnipeg consensus:
- filter out reads with mean quality score <25
- filter out reads with length < 75

title: Include prepackaged pHMMs for whole genome
Reimplement hivmmer wrapper in Python to support whole genome
body:
* Switch from hmmsearch to hmmscan using e-value thresholds determined in #7
* Run hmmscan against prepackaged pHMMs in #8  
* Use multiprocessing to run hmmscans in parallel

title: improve consistency of whole genome coverage
Add minimum coverage threshold when calling consensus sequence
Reference enquiry
body:
I downloaded the docker version for hivmmer and I noticed that the latest docker version is 0.1.2, will the latest version (0.2.0) be on docker anytime soon?

Also, I noticed that I should be building my own profile Hidden Markov Model but I am unable to figure out how to do so using hivmmer. I tried building a pHMM file for a multiple sequence alignment amino acid sequences using hmmer but it is not working either, it is only working for DNA sequences.

I also read that you have some prepackaged profile Hidden Markov Models for the pol region in version 0.1.2, how can I use them?

title: Fix handling of deletions in consensus.py
body:
Problem: Deletions are coded as an empty string "" in the codons.tsv file. As a result, if a deletion is present above the threshold frequency, it will cause the analysis of ambiguous nucleotides to fail, and no output for that HXB2 coordinate.
Solution: remove deletions prior to calculating ambiguous nucleotides.

title: access to aavf file
body: Hi, using the current hivmmer version, I obtained amino acid frequency table as xlsx file. Is there a way to access aavf file as what the tool previously provided? I am interested in getting the information on ALT_FREQ column for each position. Thanks!

title: Instruction to build a pHMM reference
body: Hi, I am analyzing subtype C sequence with hivmmer. Is there an instruction on how to build pHMM reference with my own sequence? Thanks!
